definition: worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
warm and virtuous/(used in given names)/Taiwan pr. [shu2]

sentences.english: Two things doth prolong your life: a quiet heart and a loving wife.
sentences.chinese: 心情平静妻贤淑，延年益寿多得福。

sentences.english: Man's best possession is a loving wife.
sentences.chinese: 男人最可贵的是有一个贤淑的妻子。

sentences.english: She had committed a fault, but the foundation of her nature, as will be remembered, was modesty and virtue.
sentences.chinese: 她犯了错误，但是我们记得，她的本质是贞洁贤淑的。

sentences.english: She has a pair of big eyes, a wise and virtuous.
sentences.chinese: 她有一双大大的眼睛，透露着聪慧与贤淑。

sentences.english: And many worthy and chaste dames even thus, All guiltless, meet reproach.
sentences.chinese: 许多贞洁贤淑的娘儿们，都是这样蒙上了不白之冤。

sentences.english: Hyeon-sook operates a small sashimi restaurant and a bed and breakfast to make a living on the island.
sentences.chinese: 贤淑经营一个小的生鱼片餐厅和床和早餐在岛上谋生。

definition: (of a wife) wise and kind/perfect in her traditional roles
variant of 賢慧|贤慧[xian2 hui4]
girl from a wealthy family/unmarried daughter of a noble house
see 通情達理|通情达理[tong1 qing2 da2 li3]
a good wife and loving mother
to be good at understanding others (idiom)
